results.description: Command rejects invalid or missing `--agent` flag

payload.evidence: Executed automated CLI checks for `execute test-plan`: (1) `bun src/cli.ts execute test-plan` returned exit code 1 with `Missing required --agent <provider> argument.`; (2) `bun src/cli.ts execute test-plan --agent bad-provider` returned exit code 1 with `Unknown agent provider 'bad-provider'. Valid providers: claude, codex, gemini`. Both outputs are descriptive and match expected rejection behavior.
payload.notes: Used direct entrypoint execution (`bun src/cli.ts ...`) in this workspace; behavior confirms invalid and missing `--agent` are rejected for the target command.

results.description: Command fails fast when test plan file path is missing or unreadable

payload.evidence: Executed one scoped automated check by running `bun run src/cli.ts execute test-plan --agent codex` in an isolated temp project where `.agents/state.json` had `phases.prototype.tp_generation.status="created"` and `file="it_999999_missing_TP.json"` (nonexistent). Command exited with code `1` and stderr: `Cannot execute test plan: file not found at /tmp/tmp.3374HnCtRM/.agents/flow/it_999999_missing_TP.json`.
payload.notes: TC-US001-13 acceptance is satisfied for the missing-path branch: the command fails immediately before execution flow continues.

results.description: Command rejects invalid test plan JSON/schema at `tp_generation.file`

payload.evidence: In an isolated temp project with `prototype.tp_generation.status` set to `created` and `tp_generation.file` set to `it_000005_TP.json`, running `runExecuteTestPlan({ provider: "codex" })` produced: CASE1=`Invalid test plan JSON at .agents/flow/it_000005_TP.json.` when file content was malformed JSON; CASE2=`Test plan JSON schema mismatch at .agents/flow/it_000005_TP.json.` when file content was valid JSON but schema-invalid.
payload.notes: TC-US001-14 acceptance is satisfied: the command rejects both invalid JSON and schema-invalid payloads at the path referenced by `tp_generation.file`.

results.description: Behavior when `PROJECT_CONTEXT.md` is missing/unreadable is deterministic and explicit

payload.evidence: Automated execution in a temporary project root ran `runExecuteTestPlan` with valid state/TP JSON and validated two scenarios: (1) missing `.agents/PROJECT_CONTEXT.md` threw `Project context missing: expected .agents/PROJECT_CONTEXT.md.`; (2) unreadable context (simulated `EACCES` from `readFileFn`) threw `EACCES: permission denied, open /tmp/.../.agents/PROJECT_CONTEXT.md`. Both outcomes are explicit failures before any agent invocation.
payload.notes: TC-US001-15 acceptance satisfied: behavior for missing/unreadable project context is deterministic in flow (immediate failure at context read stage) and explicit in error output.

results.description: Malformed agent output (non-JSON, truncated JSON, or missing required keys with exit code 0) is treated as test-case failure

Command output: `1/2 tests passed, 1 failed`. Verification checks all true: `malformedMarkedFailed`, `malformedHasErrorSummary`, `malformedAttemptRecorded`, `rawOutputPersisted`, `resultRecordedFailureMode`, `executionContinued`. Summary captured: `Agent output was not valid JSON.`
payload.notes: Acceptance is satisfied: malformed agent output with zero exit code is recorded as a failed test case (progress entry status `failed`, error summary populated, artifact stores raw stdout), and execution continues to the next test case.

results.description: `updated_at` changes only for entries executed in the current run

Verification output: `{"condition":true,"rerunInvokedIds":["TC-US001-02"],"timestamps":{"TC-US001-01":{"run1":"2026-02-21T17:38:09.617Z","run2":"2026-02-21T17:38:09.617Z"},"TC-US001-02":{"run1":"2026-02-21T17:38:09.617Z","run2":"2026-02-21T17:38:09.646Z"},"TC-US001-03":{"run1":"2026-02-21T17:38:09.617Z","run2":"2026-02-21T17:38:09.617Z"}}}`.
payload.notes: Acceptance satisfied for TC-US002-09: only the re-executed entry (`TC-US001-02`) changed `updated_at`; skipped previously-passed entries (`TC-US001-01`, `TC-US001-03`) retained their original timestamps.

results.description: CI-equivalent quality command (if defined by project scripts) passes

payload.evidence: Inspected project scripts in package.json; only `validate:state` and `validate:progress` are defined (`bun -e 'const p=require("./package.json"); console.log(Object.keys(p.scripts||{}).join(","))'` -> `validate:state,validate:progress`). No CI-equivalent aggregate quality script (including typecheck/lint/tests) is defined to execute.
payload.notes: TC-QG-03 requires running an existing CI-equivalent quality command if present; this repository does not currently define one in project scripts, so the test case is not executable as written.
